summary:
Denmark is a Nordic country in Northern Europe with about 6 million people. It includes the Faroe Islands and Greenland, which have some self-governance. Denmark is made up of an archipelago of islands and a peninsula. Copenhagen, the capital, is the largest city.

The country has a long history, dating back to the 8th century, and was once part of a union with Norway and Sweden. It's known for its high standard of living, welfare system, and being the first to legally recognize same-sex partnerships. Denmark is also a member of many international organizations.
title: Denmark
